channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for NC
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for NC

item.description:
Report X-2024070440

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0

  • Description: Package was found on the unolad side. Package was placed in a lined tote in brought to the QA department. Upon further investigation it was discovered that one of the containers had a loose cap and spilled inside of the box.

item.title: Report E-2024070101
item.description:
Report E-2024070101

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-09T15:13:05+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-18
  • City: ASHEVILLE
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Boasso
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: WHILE DRIVER WAS ENROUTE TO CONSIGNEE HE STOPPED AT REST AREA. INSPECTION OF VEHCILE SHOWED SLIGHT LEAK AT PRODUCT CAP ON BOTTOM. HE NOTICED PRODUCT HAD LEAKED FROM THE BOTTOM CONNECTION. CLOSURE RESEALED AND CAP WAS REPLACED. SPILL WAS CLEANED WITHOUT ANY FURTHER INCIDENT.

item.title: Report X-2024070300
item.description:
Report X-2024070300

  • City: KERNERSVILLE
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Package was found on the dock with wet outer contents. Upon inspection package was found that one of the four inner containers was completely missing its lid causing internal leakage. Package was placed into hazmat bag, and then into a salvage drum.

item.title: Report X-2024070218
item.description:
Report X-2024070218

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-05T18:14:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-27
  • City: GREENSBORO
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDER ARRIVED TO PD 8 WEARING PROPER PPE. THE PACKAGE WAS LEAKING ON THE BELT. RESPONDER USED DECISION TREE AND CORROSIVE RESPONSE SHEETS TO CLEAN UP THE SPILL. PACKAGE WAS TRANSPORTED TO DMP AREA FOR FURTHER PROCESSING.

  • Description: RESPONDER ARRIVED TO UNLOAD WEARING PROPER PPE. PACKAGE WAS SITTING ON THE CATWALK. RESPONDER USED DECICION TREE AND FLAMMABLE LIQUID RESPONSE SHEETS TO CLEAN UP THE SPILL. PACKAGE WAS TRANSPORTED TO DMP AREA FOR FURTHER PROCESSING.

item.title: Report I-2024070001
item.description:
Report I-2024070001

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-05T18:14:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-24
  • City: Greensboro
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: SOUTHEASTERN FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: During the unloading phase of trailer, employee was attempting to unload a pallet of freight with a forklift, the forklift blades were protruding past the pallet and punctured a pail in front of the pallet. Contact was made at the top side of the pail putting a 1.5 inch long puncture in the pail. Pail was then placed in a position to where the material would not leak further. All spillage of material was confined to immediate area for cleanup.
